inn1.comm: full slider to start, no spin with this new ball. Drifts on towards off, clipped to midwicket
flat and quick on middle, comes on with the arm, a thick inside edge to midwicket. Mutumbami is sent back
skids on again, absolutely no turn so far. Slightly shorter on middle, slides on to take Moor's inside edge quite late, they get one to short fine leg
quick yorker on off, blocked with a dead bat
flat and quick yet again on middle and off, worked away to mid-on for a quick run
too full this time, quick through the air on middle, drilled to long-on
nice shape from Dawlat, fullish and swinging away outside off. Moor drives with leaden-feet and is beaten.
genuine edge now, but wide of second slip and to the third man boundary. good delivery, full outside off, nice away movement. Moor doesn't get his feet close enough to the pitch and gets an edge
not great from Moor. Full and wide, that outswinger again. Moor drives from the crease but is comprehensively beaten by the movement
connects this time, fullish again, guided towards extra cover with minimal feet movement.
shortish length on middle and leg, helped on its way to fine leg
this one comes on, no away movement. Full on off, Mutumbami gets his bat down just in time.
shot! Great intent. Tossed up on off, Moor gets one foot to the line and smashes an uppish drive over mid-on, clears the boundary as well.
drags his length back, shortish on off, punched to mid-off

superb again from Moor, this was even better. Presented the full face of the bat and played with the turn. Tossed up again on off from Hamza, Moor stays in the crease and lofts the ball over the long-off boundary.
shortish on leg, pings off Moor's pads
tossed up on middle, blocked
fullish outside off, just a hint of away movement. Worked to mid-on
good delivery again, fuller than a good length on off. Pushed defensively towards cover
short and wide, that was there to be hit. Mutumbami throws his hands at it but fails to connect
poor shot from RM. Full outside off, nice away shape. RM drives from the crease, his feet planted. Beaten!
good delivery, full on middle. Clipped to mid-on
nice change in length, goes short on off. Mutumbami gets high on his toes to steer to point
poor delivery, low full toss outside off, pushed to cover. Another missed opportunity
118 kph, good length on off, played out into the off side from the crease
kept a tad low, good length outside off, Moor guides to point.
fuller delivery on middle, worked out towards square leg
fullish outside off, punched to cover
very good shot again. Good intent. Too full from Ashraf outside off, Moor stays in the crease and launches one over mid-off. Clears him easily and lands just inside the boundary
full on off, patted to cover
back of a length on off, turned to the right of mid-on for one
full length on off, Moor gets a half stride forward to defend
half-volley on off, skewed off the outside half of the bat towards extra cover.
back of a length on off, dabbed to third man
short bouncer but down leg, Mutumbami goes for the pull and gets a bit of glove on it, flies past the diving keeper and to the fine leg boundary. Not in control at all
good length on off and middle, nudged towards square leg
119 kph, not much pace from Ashraf, pushed to mid-on with the angle.
fullish outside off, driven with bad timing to extra cover
fuller than a good length on off, defended to mid-on
great timing this time, fullish outside off but this time Moor leans into it and caresses the drive, pierces the gap through extra cover for four. Magnificent shot.
good run from Moor, looking particularly good so far. Driven to mid-off for a quick run after seeing mid-off flat-footed
very full on off, Moor tries to hit that on the up but the ball stops in the pitch, driven to extra cover
back of a length outside off, Moor stands tall and remains deep in the crease, cuts to point
looking for that yorker on off, the half-volley is tucked to mid-on
just a nudge, and the ball races to the fine leg boundary. Excellent batting. Drifts down leg and Moor clips this off his pads, that's all he needed.
full outside off, drilled to extra cover
back of a length outside off, Moor thought of pulling but swayed out of the line late
full outside off, RM skips down the track to defend
full outside off, not much movement and left alone
slightly too full outside off, defended to mid-off
good length on off, nudged off to mid-on
full outside off, squirted off the outside half to cover
goes for it and connects! What a shot, after five blocks comes the big shot. Full on off, Mutumbami swipes it easily over mid-on for six crucial runs.
treated with disdain. Tossed up outside off, moor clears one foot and goes after the big shot, keeps his shape and offers the full face of the bat. Smashed over mid-off
lovely stroke. Just a punch-drive over mid-on, tossed up from Nabi and Moor pummels it for four, one-bounce boundary
pushed to long-on with the turn
blocked off the front foot
flat and quick on middle, turned towards midwicket for a run
flat on leg from wide of the crease, skids on with the arm, worked to short fine leg
flat again and quick on off, blocked to extra cover
very full on middle, no turn. Defended
fullish on off, driven back at the bowler
no flight, darted in on off. No turn. Defended
maiden! Fullish on off yet again, patted back to the bowler. Plenty of singles on offer but RM cannot find even one
good batting, some flight on off. Moor comes forward and drives to long-off
wild slog. the dot balls built on him and Mutumbami goes for the hoick. Inside-edged onto his pad
goes for the sweep this time but falls over after slipping while playing the stroke. Big appeal but turned down, hit him outside the line
flatter delivery on middle, worked to midwicket
good pressure from the fielders. Tossed upon off, nudged towards short midwicket who puts in a good diving stop. Just one of that over
flatter on off, drilled to long-off
fullish on middle and off, RM comes down and finds midwicket
poor from Dawlat! Short down leg, clipped to fine leg where Dawlat fails to collect while fielding, took his eye off it.
fired in on middle, RM dances down but hits midwicket
better from RM. Waits back and punches a drive to long-off
wide of the crease, flat outside off and driven to cover.
runs down at the flighted delivery and drives with the turn to long-on
full on middle, not much turn yet. Blocked
good fielding from Nabi. Flat outside off, pushed towards long-off but Nabi gets across and stops it with a dive
awkwardly slapped to cover
nice running, played with soft hands towards deep square leg and Moor wants two and will get it
slightly uppish, tossed up outside off and Moor plays slightly early, ends up scooping it to long-off
very full on middle, slides on with the arm. Defended
fantastic innings from Moor. Gets to his first ODI fifty with a nice punch to long-off
slower on leg, Mutumbami comes down the track and improvises well to turn to midwicket
very flat on middle, sits up for RM to crunch to long-on
fired in on off and ,middle, blocked with a full face
some flight on leg, worked away towards square leg and Mutumbami scampers back for the second. Makes it with a good full-length dive, made full use of some lackadaisical fielding.
the slider outside off, no turn. Mutumbami plays inside the line and is beaten
shortish on middle, flicked to midwicket who acrobatically stops it
flat on leg, nudged off his pads to deep square leg

Shahzad is ecstatic, he is sure he has his man. Pushed through wide outside off, Moor goes for the drive and is beaten. Shahzad does very well to whip off the bails and Moor's back foot is on the line. Shahzad's quick work earns Afghanistan their first wicket. Good stuff.
slower through the air outside off, Hamilton offers no stroke and is struck wide outside off. Not enough spin for the lbw.
very flat but down leg, wide called
pushed through fast and flat on leg, nurdled to midwicket
that one held in the pitch, well bowled. Flat on off but the ball gripped in the wicket and RM skewed the ball towards extra cover

Rokhan has his first wicket in ODIs. Flat delivery on off, the ball doesn't come on as fast as Mutumbami expected, and the ball lobbed back after a tentative drive from Mutumbami. Rokhan needed two juggles to hold on to his first wicket.
not a great delivery. Flat down leg, worked with soft hands towards fine leg, beats the short fine leg fielder who hauls it in with a dive
flat on middle, Ervine goes back to block
this time some flight on off, played back defensively
tossed up on off, worked with the spin to long-on
some flight on leg, pushed to midwicket
tossed up on off, Ervine lunges forward to defend
lots of flight outside off, skids on with the arm and Ervine's exuberant drive rolls towards long-on off the inside half
flat outside off, Masakadza punches a drive to long-off
driven back to the bowler
fired in with a round-arm action, the ball grips in the pitch and Masakadza defends
shortish and wide, driven to long-off
shot! Ervine gets down and plays a deft reverse sweep and used the pace from Rokhan.Gets down early and plays it fine towards the third man boundary.
and again, good stroke! Ervine gets down early and executes the stroke once again. Great batting. Just using the pace
tossed up on off, defended
flatter on off and middle, played back to the bowler
nicely tossed up on off, HM stays in the crease to block
very full on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
better shot! Tossed up outside off, drilled to long-off with the turn
flatter delivery outside off, Ervine strides forward to push to long-off
shortish and wide, Masakadza finds cover with a chopped cut
straighter on middle, pushed back to the bowler
extremely full outside off, easily driven with the spin to long-on
nicely bowled, slower on off, the ball spins a touch but HM defends competently
comes down and whips to long-on
slower outside off, Ervine stays in the crease to work to point
shortish on off, Ervine plays a punch-drive to long-on
nice flight on off and middle, pushed to cover
very short delivery outside off, long-hop which is pummeled to long-on
tossed up outside off, swatted to long-off
full toss outside off, Ervine punches to long-off
great shot. Lovely shot selection, tossed up down leg. Masakadza gets down early and wallops a sweep to the backward square leg fence. Great batting.
flat outside off, dug out towards long-off
shortish on middle, drilled back to the bowler
well bowled again, nice pace - the right pace. Not too quick and HM defends
slightly quick on off and middle, blocked
skips down the track and works this nicely to long-on
floated up on off, defended
fast and flat down leg, flicked with quick hands to deep square leg
nice pace and drift again, pushed towards the non-striker but the bowler gets around and stops it
full delivery on middle to start, a flick to cover ensues
falls over the ball slightly there does Ervine. Full on middle, Ervine gets his front pad too far but keeps it pout to midwicket
better stride, Ervine presses forward to drive to mid-off for one
short and wide, Masakadza chops again into the ground towards the sweeper cover
nice line. Full on middle, Ervine taps a ball back
fuller on leg, clipped to square leg to keep strike
good batting, whips a faster delivery from off to long-on
flat and quick on middle, smashed back to the bowler
slower delivery on middle, pushed to long-off
fuller delivery on off and middle, turned to long-on
flatter delivery outside off, inside-edged towards midwicket
quicker, skiddy delivery on off. Blocked!
good line and length, top of off stuff. Defended back
good idea and pretty good execution, got down early to help it over or past short fine leg. Did not get all of it but got it wide of fine leg for a couple
nurdled off his pads to square leg
tight delivery on middle and leg, cramping Ervine for room. Ervine picks out cover with his flick
slightly wider outside off, punched to mid-off
tight end to a good over. Full on off, patted to point
flatter delivery on off, skiddy ball. Inside-edged onto the pad
slightly slower but the same flat trajectory, HM plays a fin reverse sweep to short third man
Ervine, this time, goes for the reverse but fails to connect. The ball is much slower and he is through his shot, strikes him on the body
shortish on leg, pushed easily to long-on
again a bit short on off and middle, drilled to long-on from the back foot
slower ball on leg, tickled fine towards short fine leg for a quick run.
slower through the air, nice flight and good  line - on off. Defended
short delivery and dispatched. great batting from ervine, waited for the loose delivery and dispatched it. Sat up for Ervine to rock back and pummel over deep midwicket
tossed up on off, driven to cover with the spin
slightly shortish on off., Ervine comes forward to defend
some more flight and full, defended with a good stride
goes foe the reverse sweep and Masakadza nails it this time, plays it with soft hands and gets enough bat on it to beat the short third man fielder. Gets him four.
pushed off the back foot to long-on
slightly slower but down leg, nurdled to deep square leg
flatter delivery on middle, drilled to long-off
darted in on off, Ervine goes back to crunch a drive back to the bowler
full now on off, Ervine lunges forward and displays a perfect forward defensive stroke
slower legcutter outside off, pummeled to mid-off
good length on off, Masakadza clears his body and pushes the ball to long-on
goes for the proper sweep shot this time and gets enough bat on it. Just enough. Gets down early and looks to play that stroke and a bit of inside edge takes it to the fine leg boundary
pushed towards mid-off for a quick run. Good running
back of a length on off, caressed to long-on
tails back into middle, he gets a thick inside edge, the midwicket fielder dives over the ball
shapes away from middle again, he taps it with soft hands towards point for a quick single
short, and plenty of width outside off, a boundary missed as he thumps it straight to the deep point fielder
back of length delivery on middle, defended carefully
nicely behind the line of the ball as he defends it to the off side
looks to bowl the yorker, turns out to be a low full toss, driven wide of mid-off
punched wide of cover as they amble across
changes the bat grip early, even before the bowler delivers. He picks the length nicely to reverse sweep that past the short third man fielder. Delicately done. Enough pace on it to work with too
punched wide of the bowler towards long-off
plays a firm push back to the bowler
neatly nudged behind square on the leg side for a quick single
reverses away from the batsman again, nice and full on middle and off, squeezed to cover
gets behind the line of the ball and pats it towards the fielder running in from point
whipped away nicely off his hip towards deep backward square leg, the fielder was a touch late to get off the blocks, they completed the second quite easily
gets forward and blocks, he's looking solid

looks to pull, but is hustled for pace, manages to get some glove on the stroke, the square leg fielder runs in from the boundary and effects a direct hit at the non-striker's end. Third umpire called or, but he was comfortably in
punched to the Afghanistan captain at extra cover
too easy, he'll put those away even in his sleep. Long hop outside off and Masakadza slaps that behind point, no chance for the third man fielder
played back past the bowler for an easy single
length ball on middle and leg, nicely flicked to deep midwicket
punched firmly, bowler fails to get his hand on that, mid-off covers it nicely
plays the lap sweep, but picks the man at short fine leg
forced back down the ground to long-on
eased wide of the bowler
spins back in from outside off, he gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin

big opportunity missed . He was lured forward by the flight, completely deceived as he didn't get to the pitch of the ball, but the wicketkeeper Mohammad Shahzad made a hash of that one. As far as chances go, it can't get easier than that. How costly will that prove to be?
steps out and defends it to cover
pushed towards short midwicket
drifts in and spins away from middle, tucked to short midwicket again
looks to scoop it over short fine, but can't get enough bat on it, thuds into the thigh pad, Ervine is disappointed at missing out on a scoring opportunity
forced off the back foot to sweeper cover
leans forward and punches it to mid off
width on offer, he unfurls those wrists nicely but can't pierce the gap on the off side, straight to point
cracking cover drive, but a good stop by Stanikzai
leans forward and creams that one to deep cover
fails to get enough bat on that reverse paddle, rolls to short third man
drifting down leg, he looks to make room and go over the leg side, but is cramped for room
thumped down the ground, the long-on fielder gets to the ball quickly
gets back and across to punch it wide of the bowler to long-on
reverse sweep again, but once again, hit straight to the fielder
looks to step out and go down town, but the trajectory is flat, he can't get underneath it, offers the pad instead
angled in from round the stumps, tucked to short midwicket
punched to cover, good stop by the skipper
gets a thick edge that lands short of short third man, he looked to go across the line over deep midwicket
sharp turn back into middle and leg, deflects off the thigh pad to the on side
driven but can't beat the cover fielder
gets forward and smothers the spin
excellent stop off his own bowling, quickly running to his right to stop that firm push
plays the short-arm jab to midwicket
tucked wide of square leg for an easy single
plays it with the spin to midwicket
fired down leg, deflects it down to short fine leg
fuller delivery, slides back into middle and leg, angled to deep midwicket
gets a leading edge, nearly landed back into the hands of the bowler
fired into the pads, fails to make proper connection
steps out and plays it back to the bowler

done in by slow turn this time. The pressure was building and Masakadza has fallen into the trap. His eyes lit up as the delivery was tossed up over his eye line, stepped out to go over long-on, swung a little too early, was completely deceived in flight as the ball spun back in to hit the stumps. Big wicket for Afghanistan. Could be a big moment in the innings too, for Zimbabwe
gets forward and eases it wide of the point fielder, good running
pats it with soft hands to point
gets some pad on that one, they scoot across for a single
fires that one into middle, he's cramped for room, somehow gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
leans forward and turns it with the spin to midwicket
nicely angled with the spin behind square on the leg side to bring up a half-century
rapped on the pad but it was sliding down leg
slow turn on offer, lands it on middle, he checks his shot at the last moment

angled into middle and leg, he uses the pace of the bowler and paddles it delicately, nearly went all the way. The third umpire is checking if the fielder managed to pull it back in time. Barakzai is the man in question, and unfortunately, he hasn't managed to prevent that from crossing the line. Welcome boundary
powerfully swept, but straight to deep backward square leg
steps out but can't get to the pitch of the ball, tapped to cover, he was lining himself up to go over the infield
biffs that over midwicket, the two fielders in the deep converge
punched back to the bowler, good stop off his own bowling, dives full length to his left to prevent the single
starts off with a slower one on middle, he looks to turn it past square leg, but is done in by the slowness of that one, too early into the stroke, deflects off the pad to the off side
effortlessly lofted over midwicket. Full toss that was tailing away, and he just managed to get the meat of the bat on that clean swing

slower one on middle, he is too early into the stroke, through with the stroke when bat meets ball, lobs in the air, excellent effort by the man running in from long on, did all the hard work in getting towards the ball but couldn't hold on.
gets a thick inside edge that bounces over the stumps, keeper prevents the single

pacy ball on middle from wide of the crease, he looks to walk across and scoop it over short fine, but misses. There was a big appeal for lbw as well, but the ball was definitely bouncing over, they  get through for a bye in the mean time
excellent yorker, full and straight on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
fails to get hold of the pull, straight to deep square
goes for the big wild slog across the line over midwicket, fails to connect
whipped towards deep square
slogs and misses, deflects off the thigh pad to short fine
slides in with the arm on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket

he gets enough wood on that one, finally. Tried to play that stroke for a while now. It was nicely tossed up, Chigumbura skips down the track as the clean swing meats the middle of the bat, the ball sails over deep midwicket. Maximum elevation and struck so, so wonderfully. Is that the trigger Zimbabwe need?
slower bouncer on middle, he positions himself nicely to generate bat speed to put that over short fine leg, excellent improvisation
high full toss, almost over the waist, he looks to clear the front leg and smack that over cover, but can only manage to toe-end it

this time he gets enough wood on it. He had already decided he will swing come hell or high water. It so happened that the ball was a high full toss outside off, he managed to get enough bat on the slice as it rolled into the point boundary
he's muscled that over midwicket, but straight to the boundary rider in the deep
another high full toss, wonder if dew is kicking in and the ball is getting slipper. Hit to mid-off
misses the slog, deflects off the pad to the leg side

he's launched that into orbit, but a good effort by Nabi at long-on steals the thunder. It was right in the slot for him to go for the big hit, didn't perhaps get the elevation he wanted even though he struck it well, and Nabi balanced himself nicely to take the rocket hit.
flatter one on middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg
big appeal for lbw as Ervine is struck on the pad as an attempted reverse sweep goes awry, the umpire reckons it was pitching outside leg. He's right too
plays a delicate late cut but straight to short third man
mistimes the swipe across the line towards midwicket

what has he done here? A harmless full toss outside off has been hit straight to deep cover. Nothing delivery, nothing shot, really. He backs himself to clear the fielder there, hits it well but it almost seems like he forgot there was a fielder in the deep. He may have also got it a lot squarer than he would have liked. The umpire's checked for the no-ball and it seems fine. So Ervine has to make the long walk back. That is a gift.
length ball on off, he backs away and slaps that into the gap at deep extra cover
the good old Chinese cut yields him another boundary. Flies off the thick inside edge and past the wicketkeeper
width on offer, he's squeezed that down to third man

Lasith Malinga would have been proud of that yorker. Full, and dead straight, the ball tails back in just a wee bit, he was already through with the big swing, couldn't connect as the ball cannoned into the middle stump. Is there a better sight than seeing a fast bowler rattle the stumps? Me thinks not
another yorker on off, he gets a bit of bat on that and they squeeze through for a single
tucked wide of midwicket
fired down leg, easy call for the umpire
steps out and turns it towards midwicket, the throw to the keeper's end is wide but there is a back-up
punched to the man at the edge of the circle at cover
walks across the stumps to play the pick up shot over square leg, misses
backs away and slaps it to deep cover

spears in a superb yorker from wide of the crease, he steps out but can't carve that away, somehow gets some bat on it, the bowler has a go at the striker's end, Jongwe had to dish in the dive to be safe
slower ball on middle, pulled to deep midwicket

looked to clear the boundary, but the elevation was missing, didn't get enough power behind that one as the ball lodges in the hands of the long-off fielder. He didn't have to move an inch to take that dolly.
full toss outside off., hit wide of cover
gets a thick inside edge to mid-on

that has been launched into orbit, the ball has been hit to Dubai, I'd say. Right in the slot as Jongwe's fierce swing ensures the ball meets the middle of the bat, and it just kept going, and going, and going. The bowler knew as soon as it was hit that it would land somewhere in the second tier.
pulled towards wide long-on, rocket throw back to the bowler
sees the batsmen give him the charge and fires it wide, Jongwe had to reach out for it, but couldn't, the keeper misses and they steal a bye
swung into the gap between deep midwicket and long on, good running
connects a low full toss outside off towards short third man, once again was made to reach out
loopy delivery on middle and he has deposited that one over the long-on boundary. Clean connection, maximum result
clean connection and maximum result. Swings through the line, gets right underneath the ball and deposits that over long-on
squeezed to wide long-off where the fielder charges in quickly to prevent the second

inn2.comm: floats it full on middle and leg, defended towards midwicket
crunching cover drive. Leans into the stroke and eases it between cover and point, good work by the fielder
back of length delivery on middle, defended back to the bowler
excellent effort at point, but can't prevent the single, the firm hit was well stopped by Cremer, who had to move quickly to his right
gets back into the crease and taps it wide of mid-on to get off the mark
punched to Masakadza at cover
short of length on middle, he pulls it awkwardly, wide of midwicket
excellent stop by Sikandar Raza at cover, it was struck firmly, but he threw himself to his right to stop that
back of length on off, played back to the bowler
hint of extra bounce on that one., lands it a touch ahead of the good length area, the bottom hand comes off the bat as he pats it down the pitch
play and a miss. Nibbles away a touch from outside off, he pokes at that one without any conviction, lucky it didn't nick the bat
tucked towards mid-on, tight line again, not much room to work with
hops back into the crease and taps it back to the bowler
eased wide of midwicket for an easy single
gets a thick inside edge, doesn't miss the leg stump by much. He looked to force that through the off side but was cramped for room
the non-striker is hit on the box, that was bowled at length and Noor Ali just slapped it back down the ground, Shahzad couldn't avoid that in the nick of time
good stop by the fielder at short fine leg
length ball on off, played back to the bowler
that is as delightful as it can get. Stands tall and punches that one between cover and mid-off
cracking stroke but straight to cover point, he's timing the ball sweetly
whipped off his hip to deep square leg
gets back into the crease and defends it to the on side
back of length delivery on middle and leg, wristed towards square leg
excellent flick of the wrists, nice timing but can't pierce the gap, straight to midwicket
gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
solid punch to the cover fielder
bowls it full on off from wide of the crease, tucked to midwicket, Shahzad had taken off for the non-existent single, had there been a direct hit at the bowler's end, he was a dead duck
lovely thump in his strokes, this one is bowled at length on off, leans forward and crunches it to cover
width on offer and he has put that away into the gap at third man, not the fastest of outfields, enough time for the fielder to come around to keep that down to two
plays and misses, cramped for room as he looks to cut
floats it full on off, pushed back to the bowler
slapped, but one bounce to mid-off. It was in his arc, but couldn't quite get the elevation
beaten for pace. Looks to get back and ease that between cover and point, can't get any bat on it, the ball kept a touch low as well
hint of extra bounce on off, but he has the line nicely covered
punched off the back foot but straight to cover again
tucked towards midwicket for a quick single
gets some movement away off the deck this time, full on off, left alone
short, he fetches the pull from outside off and gets it into the gap at deep midwicket. The fielder who was placed there for the stroke couldn't get to the ball as the ball kept curling away from him
neat cover drive, straight to the fielder
angles it full on off from wide of the crease, played back to the bowler
gets a leading edge but lands short of cover point. He gave him the charge but had to make the adjustment at the last moment, clever bowling by Jongwe
steered down to third man
spraying into the pads, flicked to short fine leg
sweetly timed. Half volley on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg
firmly driven but straight to cover

margin for error is minimal. Fine leg was inside the ring and once he bowled it short and down leg., all it needed was for the batsman to get some tickle on that one. Neatly done this time by Noor Ali
back of length delivery on off, he rides the bounce and bunts it back down the pitch
nicely driven down the ground, bowler gets a bit of hand on it to deflect it to mid-off
toe ends a drive towards mid-off
hits the deck hard, gets some bounce on middle, defended back towards the bowler
uppish but into the gap, pushing at it with hard hands, goes towards third man
stays back inside the crease and blocks it with hard hands

this was in the slot and he threw the kitchen sink at it. Took a chance by going over the top, didn't time it well, but still got enough bat on it to clear mid-on, one bounce into the boundary. Timely one too
wristy flick towards square leg for an easy single
fired into middle and leg, he paddles it round the corner past short fine leg, cleverly done. Shahzad proves he's not just about brute force.
big appeal for LBW but it was sliding down leg, Shahzad was struck on the pad
gets forward and turns it towards short midwicket
driven past the diving short mid-on fielder
steps out but can't get to the pitch, hit back past the non-striker towards long-on. This
gets a good stride forward and blocks.
turned towards short fine leg, Noor Ali had to scamper through for the throw was a flat one at the non-striker's end
stays inside the crease and angles it to point
gets forward and taps it back to the bowler
gets forward and defends it to midwicket
angling into middle and leg, misses the whip, hit on the pad
in the slot, and boom! That has cleared the ropes quite easily. Nothing delivery, a juicy half-volley and Shahzad's powerful swing helps the ball get the elevation.
steps out and strokes it down to long-on
nicely tossed up on off, Shahzad had to reach out for it, hits it back to the bowler
gets forward and pats it back to the bowler, once again a nice loop from the bowler
almost a yorker, good flight again, squeezed to long-on
driven down the ground to long-off, sensible stuff
floats it on off, he strides forward and smothers the spin
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he looks to force it through cover
hint of movement away from off, gets forward and strokes it to long-off
there were two men to protect the short ball, third man was up but Shahzad's back cut beat the man there
full on off, played back to the bowler
sliding down leg, good take down the leg side by the wicketkeeper who was standing up to the stumps
punched wide of midwicket for an easy single
stands tall and punches it back to the bowler, good stop
skids back into middle and leg, he gets forward and blocks
gets a good stride forward to negate the turn
doesn't get underneath the ball despite stepping out, thick inside edge to midwicket
gets hold of the sweep nicely but there is a man at deep square leg precisely for that across-the-line swipe

cleanly struck this time. Steps out, gets to the pitch and thumps it down the ground, the ferocity of the stroke meant the long-on fielder had to run quickly to his left, got a bit of bad bounce perhaps as the ball bursts through his fingers
steps out to drill it down the ground but is done in by the pace of the delivery, deflects off the pad to third man
nice flight, lands it on off, turned against the spin to long-on
squeezed back past the bowler to long-on, uppish and just eludes Cremer
turn and extra bounce, he was lured forward into the defense, only to see the ball buzz past the outside edge, lovely
strays down leg, tucked towards the fine leg region, think he got some pad on it
steps out and then quickly covers the line of the ball before offering a dead bat
firm drive but straight to cover
advances down the track and muscles that over long-on. It was a flat hit, the long-on fielder flung himself to attempt a one-handed stunner, but could only watch the ball sail over
fired into middle, he gets forward and smothers the spin
skids back into him, keeps a touch low but he has the line of the ball we
steps out, the bowler shortens his length, Shahzad adjusts quickly and slaps it to long-off
rapped on the pad but the ball was angling down
looks to paddle it fine, but quickly changes the bat face to play a late cut of sorts, just about gets some bat on it, too much risk for one run
swung across the line towards deep midwicket
driven with the spin to long-off
hurries onto him after pitching on off, defended to cover
steps out and tucks it towards deep midwicket
quicker one on off, blocked
on the shorter side, he rocks back and swings it into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
flatter one on middle, punched back to the bowler, good stop
tucked to short fine leg
pushed through on middle, tucked to midwicket
Wellington Masakadza misjudges the catch at midwicket., it spun back quite a bit, Shahzad awkwardly jabbed at that one, lobbed in the air but he misjudged it

there's the breakthrough for Zimbabwe. He got to the pitch of the ball, timed it nicely, did most things right, but Craig Ervine, at long-on, had his eyes on the ball, while also knowing where the rope was behind him, before completing the catch. Big wicket against the run of play at a time when Afghanistan were slowly eating into the target

what a ripper of  delivery that pitches on middle and skids straight on from round the wicket, Nabi is hit on the back pad, as the ball runs away towards third man. Stifled appeal from the bowler, but the ball was sliding across and would have missed off stump. Close shave for the former captain
driven down to long-on for an easy single
drawn forward but the ball fizzes off the deck and beats the outside edge by a whisker
driven to the cover fielder

what a way to get to his half-century. He had already decided even before the bowler had bowled that he would give it his everything. Gets down on one knee and launches that over wide long-on. Takes off the helmet, looks towards the dressing room and soaks in the applause. Relief? Definitely.
gets forward and blocks
shortish one on middle, punched down to long-on
nice tossed up delivery on off, Shahzad blocks
flat on off, skiddy delivery which is met by the broad face of Shahzad's bat
skips down the track and goes for the big shot, does not get under it enough and can only squirt it to long-on
no, not a great delivery. too much width and enough pace on the delivery to aid Nabi's cut, did not get it where he wanted it but past short third man for four.
nice batting, slower on middle and Nabi tucks it with soft hands towards square leg to earn his team a couple.
and again! Pressing that repeat button. Waits for the flat delivery to come to him before nudging the ball in the gap at square leg for an easy brace. Afghanistan doing it nicely.
shot, picked his gap this time and used some deft touch to get himself four. Tossed up down leg, Shahzad clobbers a sweep and it beats a wide short fine leg and to the boundary
massive hoick! Not sure that is what Afghanistan need. Tossed up nicely outside off, Shahzad looks to belt it out of the ground but missed it. or was there some bat? Inconclusive.
better, gets forward to a tossed up delivery to keep it out
nice pace from Cremer, flighted on leg and Shahzad lunges forward to block
drags one short outside off, Shahzad cuts but finds extra cover
good flight again, and Shahzad's eyes light up, he goes for an expansive extra cover drive and hits it over point for some runs. Better shot selection, played with the turn.
some flight on off, Nabi treats it with respect, defends in front of his eyes
clever batting, flat on leg and Nabi clips towards square leg for one
flat outside off, muscled off the back foot to extra cover
worked off his pads to backward square leg
good delivery, not bowling it too slow. Flatter on off and Nabi goes back to punch back
slightly too full on middle, whipped towards deep square leg
good shot, gets down early and paddles it fine towards fine leg, the pair scamper two

through the gap and to the boundary. Fantastic shot. Expected that change in length, and stayed back to Cremer's flat delivery. Cut it fine past short third man, four more. Great batting against the spin
nice delivery, much straighter with not too much flight, squeezed back to the bowler
flighted on off and outside off, a thick outside edge rolls towards short third man
floated up on off, inviting an exuberant stroke but Shahzad blocks after a gigantic stride towards the ball
googly outside off, chopped away towards point
quick through the air on middle, worked to midwicket
much too short on middle, nurdled to deep square leg
shortish delivery down leg, MS is distraught after missing his fine paddle. Gets truck on the thigh pad
patted back to the bowler
shaped for the paddle sweep again but improvised well as Raza delivered it flatter on leg and shorter. Turned to deep square leg
too flat down leg, wide called
tossed up on middle, pushed to midwicket
tossed up on off and middle, pushed back to the bowler
swept away to deep fine leg for one. Flatter delivery down leg from Cremer
more convincing from Nabi, gets down early and hard-sweeps to deep square leg.
gives himself room but the bowler adjusted well, delivered it flatter and followed the backing-away Shahzad, hit to cover
cracking sound. And that has gone a mile. Googly on middle and Shahzad was aided by the premeditation. Slog sweeps it with all his muscle and power over the midwicket boundary.
tossed up on middle, Shahzad hurries down to pad it back
beautiful. Flat outside off, Nabi transfers his weight into the stroke and powers a drive past extra cover for four. Excellent stuff.
flat on middle, no room this time. Nabi goes deep in the crease and punches to cover
flat down leg, clipped to square leg
quick on off and middle, patted back
goes for the reverse sweep this time, Raza fires it down leg and Shahzad can only swat it away towards cover
nudged to midwicket with the turn
exemplary timing but placement not so much. Full and wide, Nabi leans into a drive and finds cover
goes wide of the crease and bowls it full outside off, guided into the off side
full outside off yet again, Nabi stays in his crease and dabs to point
finds the gap this time through cover for one
good length outside off, played to cover from the crease
heaved away to the midwicket fence. What power on show. Good length on off, wasn't even a bad ball but Shahzad picked the length early and swatted it away to the boundary.
shortish down leg, tickled to short fine leg who makes a good stop
ooh, just wide of midwicket! Shortish on leg, Nabi tries to clip but the ball grips in the surface, almost gets a leading edge to midwicket.
goes for the big sweep but misses again. Pitched outside leg and drifted onto Shahzad's pads. Big appeal but rightly not given.
short down leg, rank long hop, Shahzad misses an opportunity for some runs, hits his thigh pad towards short fine leg
flat on off but keeps a bit low, Nabi digs it out
drifts down leg, Nabi nudges to short fine leg
good length delivery outside off, flat-batted to cover. Tried to hit that too hard
a wide short delivery is met with a crunchy back foot punch to the sweeper cover
good length and close enough to off, steered to point
fullish outside off, Nabi comes forward to drive to cover.

massive shot. Moor messes it up at long-on, what a chance that was. Big opportunity missed. Full on middle and leg, Nabi goes for the wild hoick down the ground. Moor misjudged the catch, came in too much where he should have backtracked slightly, the ball lands inside the boundary and goes for four. Big big moment in the game
solidly blocked from the front foot
tossed up on middle and leg, driven back
great connection and when Shahzad connects, it generally doesn't matter. Dances down the track, gets to the pitch and then gets under it to send it sailing over the midwicket boundary.
slapped towards midwicket
advances again on off and middle, pushed to long-on with the turn
flat on leg, clipped to deep square leg

and again, out of the ground this time. Skims off the roof and onto the road. Races to the pitch, and then clobbers it with some muscular power, whistles over the midwicket boundary. Shahzad turning it on.
full on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket. Looked like two was on but the tiring Shahzad says no
back of a length on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
shot of the day. What was that? Short delivery on middle, head-height. Stays in his crease and flat-bats a swat over the midwicket boundary. What power and timing on that stroke, terrific to watch!
slower delivery outside off, MS comes down with a lot of adrenaline and clips to long-on
back of a length on off, pushed towards cover
good length on off and middle, defended from the crease
full on leg from wide of the crease, defended
yorker outside off, squirted back to the bowler
slower ball, 114 ks. On off and met with the broad face of Shahzad's bat

gone! What a sad way to go. Nabi has totally misjudged the second run and he has to go. Shahzad is left shaking his head. Worked away towards long-on and Shahzad scampers the first, Nabi doesn't hesitate for the second and runs back but the throw was good - on the bounce to the bowler just over the stumps. The bowler collected and whipped off the bails to find Nabi more than a foot short.
yorker outside off, pushed with bad timing to long-on

inside edge past the keeper for four. Does it really matter how they come? These are crucial runs for Afghanistan. Good length delivery outside off and Mangal gets a thick edge to the fine leg boundary
flight on leg, defended back to the bowler
starts this down leg and spins back towards leg stump. Shahzad awkwardly plays towards square leg for one
tossed up outside off, Mangal goes for the sweep but toe-ends it to the bowler
very full and straight - on middle. Mangal goes for the sweep again and just about gets bat on it
shortish and wide, chopped towards extra cover for a quick single
flatter trajectory on leg, Shahzad gets struck on the pad after missing is flick.
short and wide, badly timed to cover
overpitched, in fact may have been a full toss on off, driven back at the bowler
fullish length outside off and the ball keeps discernibly low, Mangal just about gets bat down in time
full outside off, Mangal chooses the wrong shot, goes for a wild swipe over midwicket but ends up squeezing it back to the bowler via his boot
much better! Fullish on off, drilled to long-on
fullish outside off, finds the bowler with his punch. Shahzad stays on 98
Mangal wants one, Shahzad doesn't. Tossed up on leg, squeezed towards midwicket, no run there
nice delivery, some flight and the right pace for this wicket. Driven to silly point
nicely played against the turn, slower on leg and whipped to midwicket for two
flatter on off, patted back

gone! Mangal's stumbling innings has finally ended. Tossed up nicely on off and Mangal was persistent in trying to play against the turn to the legspinner. He gets a big of a leading edge back to the bowler who takes a sitter and Mangal has to go.

googly, extracting some bounce. Stanikzai cuts it towards extra cover who misfields, lots of miscommunication. Shahzad didn't want the run but Stanikzai was almost within a foot of him at the non-strikers end. The fumble allowed the run.

bowled im. Chigumbura strikes. Chigs enjoys a jig. Shortish delivery outside off, Stanikzai goes for a full-blooded cut but the ball stops and grips in the pitch, and takes the inside edge before clattering into the stumps.
yorker on off, pushed back mid-off
120 kph, overly full on off, driven to cover
full and wide, a tentative poke from SS and he is beaten.
squeezed to the sweeper cover for one
and he remains here. Good length on off, clipped to midwicket.
tossed up but ends up being overpitched, driven back to the bowler who fumbles but no run
flat outside off, blocked
slower on off, grips and turns away from off stump. Dabbed to point
flatter again on off, driven back to the bowler
flat on off, Shenwari lunges forward to block
shortish outside off, pulled but with bad timing to deep midwicket. Just one, Shenwari keeps strike. Shahzad still on 98
good length outside off, muscled off the back foot to extra cover
he gets one here, good length outside off, guided to point who fires an inaccurate throw. A full-length dive too
good bouncer, short on leg, pulled nicely to fine leg. Rolled his wrists on it
and he gets there. Removes his helmet and pumps his fists, he kisses the badge jumps in the air. Ecstasy for Shahzad, gets there with a deft dab to third man
pushed to cover

another one for Chigs. Inzy isn't impressed. Shenwari goes now. Nips one back in and sneaks through a big gap between bat and pad and uproots the middle stump. Not much Shenwari could have done about that, no wonder there is a look of amazement on his face. He has to go though. Chigumbura's self-introduction into the attack has changed the complexion of this game.
flat delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler
flat outside off, extracts some spin but Shahzad turns this against the spin towards midwicket
taken by short leg but no bat. Slower ball on leg, clips the pad
tickled off his pads to deep fine leg
flatter on leg, Shahzad closes his bat face to get the ball towards deep square leg
flat down leg, worked away towards deep square leg
fullish on off, Najibullah blocks
four. Crucial runs. Swatted to the midwicket fence. Shortish outside off, Najibullah sees the opportunity and whacks it to the boundary from the crease.
very full and wide, Najibullah caresses a drive past cover with absolutely no feet movement. Two more
slower bouncer on middle, Najib waits for the ball before rolling the wrists on his pull to fine leg. Well played.
good length on middle, tucked to midwicket for one

gone! Another one goes. Chigs gets another. A slower ball on off and middle, Najibullah goes for a pull but gets a leading edge which lobs up int he air for midwicket to take. And a great catch too, he backtracked and took  a hard catch over his head running back.
gets forward and whips it away to deep midwicket
slow turn away from middle, tapped towards short third man
fired into the pads, turned towards midwicket, no one inside the 30-yard ring on the leg side, excellent running between the wickets
closed the bat face too early, gets a leading edge that lands between cover and point
good stop off his own bowling
drifts in and spins away just a wee bit, he has the line of the ball well covered
back of length delivery on off, he wrists it to midwicket

the ball comes back in from wide of the crease to hit him low on the pad, big appeal from the bowler but it doesn't look like there was one. Not sure why that was turned down. Mirwais Ashraf is lucky to surive.  That was plumb
stroked superbly on the up to sweeper cover
angled into middle, whipped to square leg
excellent yorker, squeezed back to the bowler, good stop
gets behind the line of the ball, taps it to the off side with soft hands
steps out and turns it towards midwicket, the bowler runs across swiftly to stop the ball
excellent commitment from the captain, dives to his right to stop a firm hit at extra cover, saved two runs for the side
squeezed back to the bowler, it was nicely tossed up, inviting him to go for the big hit if he wanted to
outstanding effort by Sikandar Raza at long-off keeps it down to two. It was a flat hit that kept going away from him, but he covered good ground, dished in the dive to stop that
cramped for room, can't cut, straight to point
fired into the stumps, played back to the bowler
full on the pads, nudged towards midwicket, the fielder in the deep was late to get off the blocks, throw was good though, but Shahzad was a shade faster
fetches a slog from outside off, toe-ends it towards deep backward square leg, back for the second quite comfortably though
short on middle, he rocks back and pulls it towards deep square
low full toss on middle, hit back hard to the bowler, who fails to get his hands on it despite the dive, the mid-off fielder dives across to stop that
fires one down leg, keeper collects. Some exercise for the umpire late in the evening
into the block hole, squeezed towards deep midwicket
low full toss on middle and leg, flicked to deep backward square
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, he offers his pad as he looks to defend
stretches forward and blocks
good, clean strike that sails over the ropes. Steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball, accounts for the spin and muscles it over long-off. That will ease some pressure
defended to the cover fielder
steps out and biffs that across the line to wide long-on
looks to step out and go over midwicket, but can't generate power off the bottom hand, rolls to the midwicket fielder. Get the feeling that Shahzad is starting to cramp a bit
spins away from middle, he gets an inside edge as he looks to defend
frees his arms and thumps it to long-off
tossed up over his eye-line and Shahzad says 'thank you very much.' Makes room, generates enough power, swings through the line and crashes that over long-off. Picked the bones out of that one
gets forward and turns it across the line towards long-on
plays and misses, squared up by sharp turn
padded away back down the pitch
full and just a touch outside off, Shahzad plays an ugly swipe, but can't connect
low full toss outside off, slapped to deep cover where Sikandar Raza moves swiftly to fire a rocket throw
squeezed away behind point, no one in the deep and that's four more to the total.
right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, keeps that out
firm drive, the cover fielder managed a half-stop and the deflection rolled towards long-off, that allowed them to complete the second

slower ball and he's picked his spot to perfection. It was right in the slot for Ashraf to unfurl the big hit, he swung clean and picked the gap at cow corner. Afghanistan inch ever so close to a 2-0 lead
Ashraf wanted the single, Shahzad sent him back, could have been chaotic if the fielder running in from point hit direct at the non-striker's end
full but sprays it down leg, looking to follow the batsman, unsuccessful
gets a thick inside edge as the slog rolls into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on. The 50 partnership is up too
length ball on off, he backs away and slaps it over cover.  That now is the highest score by an Afghanistan batsman in ODIs

the wild slog doesn't go where he intended, but he still manages to beat mid-on to the boundary. Shahzad starts off on his celebratory jig. The normally subdued Inzamam is all smiles. The entire team is on their feet. Zimbabwe absolutely gutted. What a thriller this has been
